result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Pax

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J Pax appeared by video.  
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Anthony J Pax.  
Attorney William Ackell for  Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Anthony J Pax appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Anthony J Pax.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of Defendant's prior OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay PD Officer R. May. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report ( missed scheduled alternate contact).

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. According to Attorney Kuehn the defendant was arrested last night in Sheboygan. Court will impose, but stay a warrant until the next date and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-26-2022

Defendant Anthony J Pax in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  William R. F. Ackell appeared on behalf of  for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case has not had preliminary hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.6.2022
Received and Filed. Motion to allow Zoom Appearance
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Anthony J Pax in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for State Public Defender appointment. Court finds defendant qualifies for Court appointed attorney. Attorney Lori Kuehn to be appointed at County expense, Defendant ordered to reimburse the county at $50 per month. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Indigency hearing on June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Pax in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BOTH APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-13-2022
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Pax
Current: 832 N 10th Street, Apt #104, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2022)
Prior: 512 North Grandview Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  Court advised defendant to contact Justice Point within 24 hours of this hearing.

Defendant Anthony J Pax in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Anthony J Pax in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony J Pax appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  ELIGIBILITY HAS NOT BE ESTABLISHED.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
